units.title: Integrate single-cell transcriptomics and Visium data
units.text: After integration and rely on the computational integration of coupled single-cell (or single-nucleus) transcriptomes to achieve this level of detail18–20. developed cell2location algorithm18, cell states were mapped to the endometrium and/or the myometrium.
units.rationale: This describes a computational protocol step for integrating spatial and single-cell transcriptomic data using a specific algorithm.

units.title: Map cell states to endometrium and myometrium
units.text: developed cell2location algorithm18, cell states were mapped to the endometrium and/or the myometrium.
units.rationale: This is an actionable step in the protocol to assign cell identities to specific uterine tissue layers.

units.title: Classify epithelial cells into four main groups
units.text: Epithelial cells are classified into four main groups based on their marker expression: (1) SOX9 populations, enriched in the proliferative phase and expressing genes characteristic of rising estrogen levels (MMP7, ESR1); (2) ciliated cells (PIFO, TPPP3); (3) lumenal cells (LGR5); and (4) glandular cells (SCGB2A2) (Fig. 2b–d and Extended Data Fig. 4a,b).
units.rationale: This provides a clear classification protocol for epithelial cell types using specific molecular markers.

units.title: Subcluster SOX9+ epithelial populations
units.text: With our integrative scRNA-seq maps, we can now resolve three clusters within the SOX9 population: (1) SOX9+LGR5+ cells, expressing KRT17 and WNT7A; (2) SOX9+LGR5− cells, expressing IHH; and (3) proliferative SOX9+ cells, including both LGR5+ and LGR5− cycling cells (that is, cells in G2M/S phase).
units.rationale: This outlines a protocol for subclustering SOX9+ cells based on co-expression of additional markers and cell cycle status.

units.title: Validate spatial localization using smFISH
units.text: Single-molecule fluorescence in situ hybridization (smFISH) with RNAscope probes shows higher expression of the proliferative marker MKI67 in the superficial layer of the endometrium during the proliferative phase, validating Visium data (Extended Data Fig. 5a).
units.rationale: This describes a validation protocol using smFISH to confirm spatial gene expression patterns from computational data.

units.title: Profile endometrial organoids at single-cell resolution
units.text: We profile three-dimensional endometrial organoids at single-cell resolution to characterize their hormonal responses in vitro and design a computational toolkit to compare the results with those observed in vivo to benchmark this model system.
units.rationale: This outlines a protocol for using organoids to model hormonal responses at single-cell resolution.

units.title: Modulate WNT and NOTCH pathways in organoid cultures
units.text: Finally, by modulating WNT and NOTCH pathways in the organoid cultures, we develop lineage-specific endometrial epithelial cells and define the molecular events involved in their response to ovarian hormones.
units.rationale: This describes an experimental protocol to manipulate signaling pathways in organoids to induce lineage specification.

units.title: Use CellPhoneDB v.3.0 to measure intercellular communication
units.text: We develop CellPhoneDB v.3.0 to measure intercellular communication taking into account spatial coordinates of cells and use this tool to define cell signaling in both lumenal and glandular epithelial microenvironments.
units.rationale: This specifies the use of a computational tool with spatial context to analyze cell-cell signaling as part of the protocol.
